name: google_trends_search
description: Scrape results from the Google Trends search page.

query.description: Parameter defines the query or queries you want to search. You can use anything that you would use in a regular Google Trends search. The maximum number of queries per search is 5 (this only applies to "Interest over time" and "Compared breakdown by region" data_type, other types of data will only accept 1 query per search).

geo.description: Parameter defines the location from where you want the search to originate. It defaults to Worldwide (activated when the value of geo parameter is not set or empty). Head to the Google Trends Locations for a full list of supported Google Trends locations.

region.description: Parameter is used for getting more specific results when using "Compared breakdown by region" and "Interest by region" data_type charts. Other data_type charts do not accept region parameter. The default value depends on the geo location that is set. Available options: COUNTRY(country), REGION(subregion), DMA(metro), CITY(city).

data_type.description: Parameter defines the type of search you want to do. Available options: TIMESERIES - Interest over time (default), GEO_MAP - Compared breakdown by region, GEO_MAP_0 - Interest by region, RELATED_TOPICS - Related topics, RELATED_QUERIES - Related queries.

tz.description: Parameter is used to define a time zone. The default value is set to 420 (Pacific Day Time(PDT): -07:00). Value is shown in minutes and can span from -1439 to 1439.

cat.description: Parameter is used to define a search category. The default value is set to 0 ("All categories"). Head to the Google Trends Categories for a full list of supported Google Trends Categories.

gprop.description: Parameter is used for sorting results by property. The default property is set to Web Search (activated when the value of gprop parameter is not set or empty). Other available options: images - Image Search, news - News Search, froogle - Google Shopping, youtube - YouTube Search

date.description: Parameter is used to define a date. Available options: now 1-H - Past hour, now 4-H - Past 4 hours, now 1-d - Past day, now 7-d - Past 7 days, today 1-m - Past 30 days, today 3-m - Past 90 days, today 12-m - Past 12 months, today 5-y - Past 5 years, all - 2004 - present. You can also pass custom values: Dates from 2004 to present: yyyy-mm-dd yyyy-mm-dd (e.g. 2021-10-15 2022-05-25). Dates with hours within a week range: yyyy-mm-ddThh yyyy-mm-ddThh

api_key.description: Parameter defines the SerpApi private key to use.

limit.description: Number of results to return per call. Default: 5.

offset.description: Number of results to skip. Default: 0.

name: google_trends_autocomplete_search
description: Scrape suggested searches from the Google Trends search page.

query.description: Parameter defines the query you want to search. You can use anything that you would use in a regular Google Trends search. The query is used to retrieve suggested searches.

api_key.description: Parameter defines the SerpApi private key to use.

name: ask_to_user
description: You can ask user for guidance when you think you need more information to handle the task, but you should use this tool as less as you can.

question.description: The question you want to ask to user.

name: finish
description: Finish the task and give your answer.
